OptionChoice.name: enableReactorCraft
OptionChoice.Description: Should Custom Ore Generation handle ReactorCraft ore generation?

Choice.description: Use Custom Ore Generation to handle ReactorCraft ores.
ReactorCraft ores will be handled by the mod itself.

OptionChoice.name: cleanUpReactorCraft
OptionChoice.Description: Should Custom Ore Generation use the Substitution Pass to remove all instances of ReactorCraft ore from the world? If the mod's oregen can be turned off in its configuration, then it's recommended to do so, as the substitution pass can slow the game significantly. If this option is disabled without disabling the mod's own ore generation, you'll end up with two oregens working at once, flooding the world with ore. Enabled by default to ensure the ores are completely removed.

Choice.description: Use the substitution pass to clean up ReactorCraft ores.
ReactorCraft ores do not need to be cleaned up by a substitution pass.

OptionChoice.name: recrPitchblendeDist
OptionChoice.Description: Controls how Pitchblende is generated

Choice.Description: Large veins filled very lightly with ore.
Large irregular clouds filled lightly with ore.
Simulates Vanilla Minecraft.

Choice.description: Pitchblende is not generated in the world.

OptionNumeric.name: recrPitchblendeFreq
OptionNumeric.Description: Frequency multiplier for ReactorCraft Pitchblende distributions

OptionNumeric.name: recrPitchblendeSize
OptionNumeric.Description: Size multiplier for ReactorCraft Pitchblende distributions

Choice.description: Cadmium is not generated in the world.

Substitute.name: recrOverworldBlockSubstitute0
Substitute.Comment: The global option deferredPopulationRange must be large enough to catch all ore clusters (>= 32).

Veins.name: recrPitchblendeVeins
Veins.Description: Large veins filled very lightly with ore. Because they contain less ore per volume, these veins are relatively wide and long. Mining the ore from them is time consuming compared to solid ore veins. They are also more difficult to follow, since it is harder to get an idea of their direction while mining.

Cloud.name: recrPitchblendeCloud
Cloud.Description: Large irregular clouds filled lightly with ore. These are huge, spanning several adjacent chunks, and consequently rather rare. They contain a sizeable amount of ore, but it takes some time and effort to mine due to low density. The intent for strategic clouds is that the player will need to actively search for one and then set up a semi- permanent mining base and spend some time actually mining the ore.

Veins.name: recrPitchblendeHintVeins
Veins.Description: Single blocks, generously scattered through all heights (density is about that of vanilla iron ore). They will replace dirt and sandstone (but not grass or sand), so they can be found nearer to the surface than most ores. Intened to be used as a child distribution for large, rare strategic deposits that would otherwise be very difficult to find. Note that the frequency is multiplied by ground level to maintain a constant density, but not by ore frequency because it is assumed that the frequency of the parent distribution will already be scaled by that.

StandardGen.name: recrPitchblendeStandard
StandardGen.Description: A master preset for standardgen ore distributions.

Veins.name: recrCadmiumVeins
Veins.Description: Small, fairly rare motherlodes with 2-4 horizontal veins each.

Veins.Description: Single blocks, generously scattered through all heights (density is about that of vanilla iron ore). They will replace dirt and sandstone (but not grass or sand), so they can be found nearer to the surface than most ores. Intened to be used as a child distribution for large, rare strategic deposits that would otherwise be very difficult to find. Note that the frequency is multiplied by ground level to maintain a constant density, but not by ore frequency because it is assumed that the frequency of the parent distribution will already be scaled by that.

StandardGen.name: recrBlueFluoriteStandard
StandardGen.Description: A master preset for standardgen ore distributions.

Veins.name: recrMountainBlueFluoriteVeins
Veins.Description: Small, fairly rare motherlodes with 2-4 horizontal veins each.

Cloud.name: recrMountainBlueFluoriteCloud
Cloud.Description: Large irregular clouds filled lightly with ore. These are huge, spanning several adjacent chunks, and consequently rather rare. They contain a sizeable amount of ore, but it takes some time and effort to mine due to low density. The intent for strategic clouds is that the player will need to actively search for one and then set up a semi- permanent mining base and spend some time actually mining the ore.

Substitute.name: recrNetherBlockSubstitute0
Substitute.Comment: The global option deferredPopulationRange must be large enough to catch all ore clusters (>= 32).

Veins.name: recrAmmoniumChlorideVeins
Veins.Description: Large veins filled very lightly with ore. Because they contain less ore per volume, these veins are relatively wide and long. Mining the ore from them is time consuming compared to solid ore veins. They are also more difficult to follow, since it is harder to get an idea of their direction while mining.

Cloud.name: recrAmmoniumChlorideCloud
Cloud.Description: Large irregular clouds filled lightly with ore. These are huge, spanning several adjacent chunks, and consequently rather rare. They contain a sizeable amount of ore, but it takes some time and effort to mine due to low density. The intent for strategic clouds is that the player will need to actively search for one and then set up a semi- permanent mining base and spend some time actually mining the ore.
